verses.verse: Boast <S%H1984><s%> not thyself of to-morrow <S%H4279><s%>; For thou knowest <S%H3045><s%> not what a day <S%H4279><s%> may bring forth <S%H3205><s%>.
Let another man <S%H2114><s%> praise <S%H1984><s%> thee <S%H6310><s%>, and not thine own mouth; A stranger <S%H5237><s%>, and not thine own lips <S%H8193><s%>.
A stone <S%H68><s%> is heavy <S%H3514><s%>, and the sand <S%H2344><s%> weighty <S%H5192><s%>; But a fool <S%H191><s%>'s vexation <S%H3708><s%> is heavier <S%H3515><s%> than they both <S%H8147><s%>.
Wrath <S%H2534><s%> is cruel <S%H395><s%>, and anger <S%H639><s%> is overwhelming <S%H7858><s%>; But who is able to stand <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> jealousy <S%H7068><s%>?
Better <S%H2896><s%> is open <S%H1540><s%> rebuke <S%H8433><s%> Than love <S%H160><s%> that is hidden <S%H5641><s%>.
Faithful <S%H539><s%> are the wounds <S%H6482><s%> of a friend <S%H157><s%>; But the kisses <S%H5390><s%> of an enemy <S%H8130><s%> are profuse <S%H6280><s%>.
The full <S%H7649><s%> soul <S%H5315><s%> loatheth <S%H947><s%> a honeycomb <S%H5317><s%>; But to the hungry <S%H7457><s%> soul <S%H5315><s%> every bitter thing <S%H4751><s%> is sweet <S%H4966><s%>.
As a bird <S%H6833><s%> that wandereth <S%H5074><s%> from her nest <S%H7064><s%>, So is a man <S%H376><s%> that wandereth <S%H5074><s%> from his place <S%H4725><s%>.

Oil <S%H8081><s%> and perfume <S%H7004><s%> rejoice <S%H8055><s%> the heart <S%H3820><s%>; So doth the sweetness <S%H4986><s%> of a man <S%H7453><s%>'s friend that cometh of hearty <S%H5315><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%>.

Thine own friend <S%H7453><s%>, and thy father <S%H1><s%>'s friend <S%H7453><s%>, forsake <S%H5800><s%> not <S%H935><s%>; And go not to thy brother <S%H251><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of thy calamity <S%H343><s%>: Better <S%H2896><s%> is a neighbor <S%H7934><s%> that is near <S%H7138><s%> than a brother <S%H251><s%> far off <S%H7350><s%>.
My son <S%H1121><s%>, be wise <S%H2449><s%>, and make my heart <S%H3820><s%> glad <S%H8055><s%>, That I may answer <S%H7725><s%> him that reproacheth me <S%H2778><s%>.
A prudent <S%H6175><s%> man seeth <S%H7200><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%>, and hideth <S%H5641><s%> himself <S%H6612><s%>; But the simple pass on <S%H5674><s%>, and suffer for it <S%H6064><s%>.
Take <S%H3947><s%> his garment <S%H899><s%> that is surety <S%H6148><s%> for a stranger <S%H2114><s%>; And hold him in pledge <S%H2254><s%> that is surety for a foreign woman <S%H5237><s%>.

He that blesseth <S%H1288><s%> his friend <S%H7453><s%> with a loud <S%H1419><s%> voice <S%H6963><s%>, rising early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%>, It shall be counted <S%H2803><s%> a curse to him <S%H7045><s%>.
A continual <S%H2956><s%> dropping <S%H1812><s%> in a very rainy <S%H5464><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> And a contentious <S%H4079><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> are alike <S%H7737><s%>:
He that would restrain <S%H6845><s%> her restraineth <S%H6845><s%> the wind <S%H7307><s%>; And his right hand <S%H3225><s%> encountereth <S%H7121><s%> oil <S%H8081><s%>.
Iron <S%H1270><s%> sharpeneth <S%H2300><s%> iron <S%H1270><s%>; So a man <S%H376><s%> sharpeneth <S%H2300><s%> the countenance <S%H6440><s%> of his friend <S%H7453><s%>.

Whoso keepeth <S%H5341><s%> the fig-tree <S%H8384><s%> shall eat <S%H398><s%> the fruit <S%H6529><s%> thereof <S%H8104><s%>; And he that regardeth his master <S%H113><s%> shall be honored <S%H3513><s%>.
As in water <S%H4325><s%> face <S%H6440><s%> answereth to face <S%H6440><s%>, So the heart <S%H3820><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> to man <S%H120><s%>.
Sheol <S%H7585><s%> and Abaddon <S%H11><s%> are never <S%H3808><s%> satisfied <S%H7646><s%>; And the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of man <S%H120><s%> are never satisfied <S%H7646><s%>.
The refining pot <S%H4715><s%> is for silver <S%H3701><s%>, and the furnace <S%H3564><s%> for gold <S%H2091><s%>; And a man <S%H376><s%> is tried <S%H6310><s%> by his praise <S%H4110><s%>.

Though thou shouldest bray <S%H3806><s%> a fool <S%H191><s%> in a mortar <S%H4388><s%> with <S%H8432><s%> a pestle <S%H5940><s%> along with bruised grain <S%H7383><s%>, Yet will not his foolishness <S%H200><s%> depart from him <S%H5493><s%>.
Be thou diligent <S%H3045><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> the state <S%H6440><s%> of thy flocks <S%H6629><s%>, And look <S%H7896><s%> well <S%H3820><s%> to thy herds <S%H5739><s%>:
For riches <S%H2633><s%> are not for ever <S%H5769><s%>: And doth the crown <S%H5145><s%> endure unto all <S%H1755><s%> generations <S%H1755><s%>?

The hay <S%H2682><s%> is carried <S%H1540><s%>, and the tender grass <S%H1877><s%> showeth <S%H7200><s%> itself <S%H6212><s%>, And the herbs of the mountains <S%H2022><s%> are gathered in <S%H622><s%>.
The lambs <S%H3532><s%> are for thy clothing <S%H3830><s%>, And the goats <S%H6260><s%> are the price <S%H4242><s%> of the field <S%H7704><s%>;

And there will be goats <S%H5795><s%>' milk <S%H2461><s%> enough <S%H1767><s%> for thy food <S%H3899><s%>, for the food <S%H3899><s%> of thy household <S%H1004><s%>, And maintenance <S%H2416><s%> for thy maidens <S%H5291><s%>.
